Description: Fragment of rim and wall of East Greek pottery plate, slipped inside; on top of rim, between bands, hook frieze; band at outside on floor, lotus and bud frieze to centre. Exterior very worn with two wide, dilute bands, one at the edge of the rim at the carination, the other at the top of the bowl.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 28, no. 100 pl. 27)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.130)
